data.title: Neat Little Find
data.text:
Stopped in for a lite dinner with the spouse, our son the new Alameda resident and his SO.  Wine and Waffles?  Yup.  Turns out to be a very cute/hip place, albeit pretty small. There were a couple of guys playing music and singing jazz tunes, and a very cozy atmosphere.
The eating menu is small, a few salads, and some waffle dishes that seem perhaps to be pulled from the Ollie's Waffle shop next door.  Among the things we had were chicken and waffle sliders, a waffle avocado lettuce & tomato, and some kind of banana dessert, along with a decent Zin to drink with it.  Fun place in downtown to stop in  and have a light bite and a drink.

data.title: Best Happy Hour Special, Best Date Location, Best Hostess (aka Mandie)
data.text:
Love this place!!! 

The food is amazing
- must try the mac and cheese
- the chicken an waffles with the whiskey syrup is yummie!!

The host is amazing and the wine flights are to die for...LOVE IT!!!

data.title: Go elsewhere for your wine
data.text: Very average wine so go to other places in Alameda for your wine.  I thought Andrew would be an asset but he turned out to be not  hospitable.

data.title: Fantastic
data.text:
The service at Wine and Waffles is top notch.  The staff are mostly pretty knowledgeable on the wines they have and the atmosphere is very relaxed and inviting.

The prices are fairly average and the waffles, I mean come on, they're delicious!  They're thinner than I necessarily expected but with all the toppings they're still delicious.  I've tried several.

I wish the menu was a little less fancy - I don't like spicy foods and the chicken had pepper flakes in the batter that the server didn't know about when I went in once, but I'm sure that's not a problem for most people.

My biggest complaint is that I wish they had more sweet wines - Moscotos, Rieslings, etc. - on the menu.  It's very red heavy so even just some other whites on the sweeter side might be nice.  Otherwise I love going there!
